thread.title: Adele: ‘I didn’t have any points to prove’
thread.title_full: Adele: ‘I didn’t have any points to prove’

title: Adele: ‘I didn’t have any points to prove’
text:
Adele says she ‘didn’t have any points to prove’ with new song Carlos Greer and Network Writers New York Post Adele says she ‘didn’t have any points to prove’ with new song Carlos Greer and Network Writers New York Post Brit pop ... Celebrities and fans alike have rejoiced over the return of Adele. Picture: AP 
BRITISH singer Adele has shed light on her comeback single, Hello , which she debuted on Friday. 
“It happened quickly when I was writing it, so that was a good sign,” she told ­a New York radio station. “But also it’s incredibly conversational. I didn’t want to come back with some spectacular point. I didn’t have any points to prove.”The song’s video features former The Wire star Tristan “Mack” Wilds. Adele’s releasing her first album since 2011, dubbed 25 , on November 20. Adele - Hello 
Celebrities, meanwhile, have been going crazy over Adele’s return, with Kate Hudson, Sam Smith, Kelly Clarkson, Russell Crowe and Katy Perry all publicly expressing their admiration for the British singer’s new tune. 
Perhaps no one had a more emotional reaction than Kate Hudson, though — the actor posted an Instagram showing her crying while wearing headphones. 
“When @adele puts out a new single ... She’s done it again! #Hello #25 #SheHadMeAtHello,” wrote Hudson. Celebs weigh in on the new Adele tune. Kate Hudson gets emotional over Adele Sun is shining because Adele — Lena Dunham (@lenadunham) October 23, 2015 Listen's to "hello" from @OfficialAdele once pic.twitter.com/Ni8PGofJOW — KATY PERRY (@katyperry) October 23, 2015 Oh my goodness @OfficialAdele I love #hello :) You never disappoint! I can't wait to hear the whole album! #worththewait #supportgreatmusic — Kelly Clarkson (@kelly_clarkson) October 23, 2015 Huge song....love this girl... https://t.co/eSELjwgqN7 via youtube — Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) October 23, 2015 Other Stories
